Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, showing one land habitat (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and one water habitat (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can include a variety of plants in each habitat, showing different types such as trees, grasses, or flowering plants.
The student can include a variety of animals in each habitat, showing different types such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can make comparisons between the plants and animals in the two habitats by labeling or illustrating differences.
The student can demonstrate patterns of diversity by showing how different living things are found in different habitats.
